name: putatively
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
generally thought or claimed to be a certain way, although it may not be: Complaints will be reviewed by a putatively independent panel. The film is a putatively heartwarming buddy comedy. See
putative
More examplesFewer examplesHis allies have been appointed to head the three putatively independent watchdog agencies. The press is behaving putatively. The Institute is the putatively nonpartisan research arm of a centrist commission.
